head.title: National Briefing | The Rockies: Montana: A Victory For Darwin

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | The Rockies: Montana: A Victory For Darwin

abstract.p: Two advocates of teaching evolution in public schools are elected to Darby, Mont, school board, defeating candidates who endorsed proposal by local Baptist minister Curtis Brinkley to incorporate criticisms of Darwin's theories into curriculum (S)

block.p: Two advocates of teaching evolution in public schools were elected Tuesday to the school board in Darby, Mont., a town of 754 people that became a focus in a national debate over religion and science. They defeated candidates who endorsed a proposal by a local Baptist minister, Curtis Brickley, to incorporate criticisms of Charles Darwin's theories of evolution into the science curriculum and created a new majority on the board opposing Mr. Brickley.
